description: Staphylococcus aureus is a Gram-positive, round-shaped bacterium that is a member of the Firmicutes, and it is a usual member of the microbiota of the body, frequently found in the upper respiratory tract and on the skin. In most studies it is the commonest significant blood culture isolate in hospitalized patients and the second commonest community-acquired isolate, accounting for around 20% to 25% of total blood culture isolates.
name: Staphylococcus aureus Antibodies and Antigens
